heroSection.heroText: Ukrainian artist, master of still life painting, who devoted her life to art and raising a creative family. Her paintings are permeated with color and light, and her pedagogical activity - a sincere love for young talents.

heroImg.imgAlt: Tamara Chebotaru is the mother of Ukrainian artist Andrei Chebotaru

stories.story1: Born May 7, 1954 in the village of Glubokoye, Odessa region.
stories.story2: Graduated from the Faculty of Art and Graphic Arts of Odessa Pedagogical Institute. She studied under Prof. V. A. Gegomyan - a student of Martiros Saryan.
stories.story3: In 1977 she began her professional activity in Sevastopol.
stories.story4: Worked as a teacher in the art studio and artist-decorator in the cultural complex “Korabel”.
stories.story5: Wife of the famous Crimean artist Nikolai Chebotaru.

listOfItems.item1: The author of a vivid and recognizable artistic style based on expressive color solutions and textural technique.
listOfItems.item2: Her still lifes have become true pictorial revelations, capable of touching not only the eye, but also the soul.
listOfItems.item3: Participant of many city, regional, all-Ukrainian and international art exhibitions.
listOfItems.item4: Works are kept in private collections and galleries in Ukraine, France, the Netherlands, Greece, Hungary and other countries.

quoteSection.text: Color is my poetry. I don't just paint an object, I look for its mood, voice, breath of light.
quoteSection.author: - Tamara Chebotaru

heroSection.heroText: Soviet and Ukrainian painter, father of Andrei Chebotaru. A painter with a pronounced impressionist handwriting, he left a noticeable trace in the fine arts of Crimea and Ukraine. His path in art is decades of teaching, creative pursuits and participation in numerous exhibitions, as well as a profound influence on the formation of his son's artistic vision.

heroImg.imgAlt: Nicolae Chebotaru is the father of Ukrainian artist Andrei Chebotaru

stories.story1: Born December 26, 1948 in the village of Glubokoye, Odessa region.
stories.story2: In 1972 he entered the Republican Art School named after I.E. Repin in Chisinau.
stories.story4: From 1976 to 1979 - teacher at a children's art school in Moldavia.
stories.story5: Since 1979 - artist in art and production workshops in Sevastopol.
stories.story6: Since 1982 - member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

listOfItems.item1: Participant of all-union, republican and city art exhibitions.
listOfItems.item2: His paintings are distinguished by the play of light and shadow, a lively palette and deep emotionality.
listOfItems.item3: The artist's style is close to impressionism: he subtly conveyed the atmosphere, light and mood of the landscape.
listOfItems.item4: The works are in private collections and galleries in Ukraine and abroad.
listOfItems.item5: Today continues his creative activity in Kiev.
